etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin resolutio(n-), from resolvere ‘loosen, release’ (see resolve)

definitions: a firm decision to do or not to do something

examples.text: she kept her resolution not to see Anne any more

shortDefinitions: firm decision to do or not to do something

definitions: a formal expression of opinion or intention agreed on by a legislative body or other formal meeting, typically after taking a vote
shortDefinitions: formal expression of opinion or intention agreed on by legislative body or other formal meeting

definitions: the quality of being determined or resolute

examples.text: he handled the last British actions of the war with resolution

shortDefinitions: quality of being determined or resolute

definitions: the action of solving a problem or contentious matter

examples.text: the peaceful resolution of all disputes
a successful resolution to the problem

shortDefinitions: action of solving problem or contentious matter

definitions: the passing of a discord into a concord during the course of changing harmony

examples.text: tension is released by the resolution from the dominant to the tonic chord

shortDefinitions: passing of discord into concord during course of changing harmony

definitions: the disappearance of a symptom or condition

examples.text: complete remission was defined as resolution of clinical evidence of disease

definitions: the process of reducing or separating something into constituent parts or components.
shortDefinitions: process of reducing or separating something into constituent parts or components

definitions: the replacing of a single force or other vector quantity by two or more jointly equivalent to it.
shortDefinitions: replacing of single force or other vector quantity by two

definitions: the smallest interval measurable by a telescope or other scientific instrument; the resolving power.
the degree of detail visible in a photographic or television image
shortDefinitions: degree of detail visible in photographic or television image

definitions: the conversion of something abstract into another form

examples.text: the gradual resolution of an uncertain feeling into a named emotion

shortDefinitions: conversion of something abstract into another form

definitions: the substitution of two short syllables for one long one.
shortDefinitions: substitution of two short syllables for one long one
